item.description:
I was introduced to the loveliest place yesterday and need to go back and see it again. This is the most phenomenal view I've seen of the Quabbin Reservoir via foot. If you have a camera, you'll want to bring it! I wish I could post this for this weekend but have too many prior commitments.

Please read.....

Please be prepared for windy conditions alongside the water and at the summit.

Some sort of foot stabilizers or micro-spikes are required for this hike.

I expect this hike to take 4 1/2 - 5 hours (with our breaks included).


This is an approximately 9 mile loop hike over mostly Quabbin roads, some still have old worn pavement, some are dirt. We will be hiking a trail to the summit of Soap Stone Hill, which is rather steep at that point, but we will take it slowly, and the trail continues beyond the summit along a ridge and eventually to the Federated Women's State Forest. On our return trip, we will be taking Gate 36  which is an unpaved road back to the partially paved road along side the Quabbin waters and back to Gate 35.

Planned breaks:

 Just before our climb to the summit, we can break briefly for food and water.

We can take in the view at the summit.

At the Federated Women's Forest, we'll take another short break so anyone who wants to can make use of the Port-a-Pottie available. (The rest of our trip has no facilities.(It is extremely important that you tell someone if you go off trail so you are not left behind.)

Our starting point has been changed to Quabbin Gate 35 as the parking was not adequate at The Federated Women's Forest. It is just past that location off rt 122. Take Old Dana Road to the end to find the gate. Parking is roadside.

 


 Directions:  


From points west on Rte. 2:

Take Exit 16 and go south on Rt 202.

Turn left on Rt 122 and go about 3 miles to Old North Dana Rd.

Turn right onto Old Dana Rd and proceed 1 mile to Gate 35.



From points east on Rte 2:

Take the Athol/Petersham exit (second Athol exit),

bear right onto Petersham Rd through the center of Petersham to Rte 122 intersection.

Take a right at the intersection onto Rte 122.

Old Dana Road will be on your left in approximately 4 1/2 miles, maybe less, maybe more;-).

 

Starting and ending point:

Quabbin Gate 35

Old North Dana Rd., New Salem, MA

Description of hike:

A gate leading to a terrific path along the shores of the Quabbin Reservoir.

Federated Women's Club State Forest New Salem Rd. (Rte. 122), Petersham, MA (978) 939-8962 Numerous trails, one to an overlook of Quabbin Reservoir, plus primitive camping (see camping section). Description: With over 1,000 acres, this forest extends the lands that protect the Quabbin Reservoir; tent campers can stay here (with a permit from Dennison Lake Recreation Area, 978-939-8962) as they explore the reservoir.

The camping area, in fact, lies very near Gate 36, the trail through which leads directly to the shore. There’s much to explore in the state forest as well, however - a very scenic drive or hike on State Forest Rd. along Fever Brook and other, unmarked trails to the boulder-strewn Gorge and to the summit of Soapstone Hill, with a wonderful view of the Quabbin. As its name implies, this land was purchased by the Massachusetts State Federation of Women’s Club and then given to the Commonwealth.
